description: json schema for an openrtb v2.1 bid request (http://www.iab.net/media/file/OpenRTB-API-Specification-Version-2-1-FINAL.pdf)
title: openrtb-v2_1-schema-bid_request

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___minduration.description: Minimum video ad duration in seconds
___minduration.title: Minimum Duration (minduration)

___h.description: Height of the player in pixels. This field is not required, but it’s highly recommended that this information be included.
___h.title: Player Height (h)

___startdelay.description: Indicates the start delay in seconds for preroll, midroll, or postroll ad placement. See Table 6.9 Video Start Delay for generic placement values
___startdelay.title: Start Delay (startdelay)

___companionad.description: If companion ads are available, they can be listed as an array of banner objects. See Banner Object.
___companionad.title: Companion Ads (companionad)

___maxextended.description: Maximum extended video ad duration, if extension is allowed.  If blank or 0, extension is not allowed. If -1, extension is allowed, and there is no time limit imposed. If greater than 0, then the value represents the number of seconds of extended play supported beyond the maxduration value.
___maxextended.title: Maximum extended duration (maxextended)

___delivery.description: List of supported delivery methods (streaming, progressive). If blank, assume all are supported. See Table 6.12 Content Delivery Methods for a list of possible values.
___delivery.title: Delivery methods (delivery)

___mimes.description: Content MIME types supported. Popular MIME types include, but are not limited to 'video/x-mswmv' for Windows Media, and 'video/x-flv' for Flash Video.
___mimes.title: Mime type whitelist (mimes)

___linearity.description: Indicates whether the ad impression is linear or non-linear. See Table 6.6 Video Linearity for a list of the possible values
___linearity.title: Video Linearity (linearity)

___minbitrate.description: Minimum bit rate in Kbps. Exchange may set this dynamically, or universally across their set of publishers.
___minbitrate.title: Minimum bitrate (minbitrate)

___w.description: Width of the player in pixels. This field is not required, but it’s highly recommended that this information be included.
___w.title: Player Width (w)

___sequence.description: If multiple ad impressions are offered in the same bid request, the sequence number will allow for the coordinated delivery of multiple creatives
___sequence.title: Ad Sequency (sequence)

___playbackmethod.description: List of allowed playback methods. If blank, assume that all are allowed. See Table 6.8 Video Playback Methods for a list of possible values.
___playbackmethod.title: Playback methods (playbackmethod)

___api.description: List of supported API frameworks for this impression. (See Table 6.4 API Frameworks). If an API is not explicitly listed it is assumed not to be supported.
___api.title: Supported APIs (api)

___protocol.description: Video bid response protocols.  See Table 6.7 Video Bid Response Protocols for a list of possible values
___protocol.title: Protocol (protocol)

___maxbitrate.description: Maximum bit rate in Kbps. Exchange may set this dynamically, or universally across their set of publishers.
___maxbitrate.title: Maximum bitrate (maxbitrate)

___battr.description: Blocked creative attributes. See Table 6.3 Creative Attributes. If blank assume all types are allowed.
___battr.title: Blocked creative attributes (battr)

___companiontype.description: Recommended if companion objects are included. See Table 6.17 VAST Companion Types for a list of possible values.
___companiontype.title: Companion Types (companiontype)

___maxduration.description: Maximum video ad duration in seconds
___maxduration.title: Maximum Duration (maxduration)

___boxingallowed.description: If exchange publisher has rules preventing letter boxing of 4x3 content to play in a 16x9 window, then this should be set to false. Default setting is true, which assumes that boxing of content to fit into a window is allowed. '1' indicates boxing is allowed. '0' indicates it is not allowed.
___boxingallowed.title: Boxing (boxingallowed)

___video.description: A reference to a video object. Either a banner or video object (or both if the impression could be either) must be included in an impression object.
___video.title: A video object (video)

___instl.description: 1 if the ad is interstitial or full screen; else 0 (i.e., no).
___instl.title: Interstitial/Full Screen (instl)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___expdir.description: Specify properties for an expandable ad. See Table 6.11 Expandable Direction for possible values.
___expdir.title: Expandable properties (expdir)

___w.description: Width of the impression in pixels. Since some ad types are not restricted by size this field is not required, but it’s highly recommended that this information be included when possible.
___w.title: Width (w)

___h.description: Height of the impression in pixels. Since some ad types are not restricted by size this field is not required, but it’s highly recommended that this information be included when possible.
___h.title: Height (h)

___topframe.description: Specify if the banner is delivered in the top frame or in an iframe. '0' means it is not in the top frame, and '1' means that it is.
___topframe.title: Delivery frame (topframe)

___api.description: List of supported API frameworks for this banner. (See Table 6.4 API Frameworks). If an API is not explicitly listed it is assumed not to be supported.
___api.title: Supported API frameworks (api)

___battr.description: Blocked creative attributes. See Table 6.3 Creative Attributes. If blank assume all types are allowed.
___battr.title: Blocked Creative Attributes (battr)

___btype.description: Blocked creative types. See Table 6.2 Banner Ad Types. If blank, assume all types are allowed.
___btype.title: Blocked Creative Types (btype)

___mimes.description: Whitelist of content MIME types supported. Popular MIME types include, but are not limited to 'image/jpg', 'image/gif' and 'application/x-shockwave-flash'
___mimes.title: Mime type whitelist (mimes)

___id.description: Unique identifier for this banner object. Useful for tracking multiple banner objects (e.g., in companion banner array). Usually starts with 1, increasing with each object. Combination of impression id banner object should be unique.
___id.title: Banner Id (id)

___banner.description: A reference to a banner object. Either a banner or video object(or both if the impression could be either) must be included in an impression object
___banner.title: A banner object (banner)

___displaymanagerver.description: Version of ad mediation partner, SDK technology, or native player responsible for rendering ad (typically video or mobile). Used by some ad servers to customize ad code by partner
___displaymanagerver.title: Video/Native display manager version (displaymanagerver)

___bidfloor.description: Bid floor for this impression (in CPM of bidfloorcur).
___bidfloor.title: Bid Floor (bidfloor)

___bidfloorcur.description: If bid floor is specified and multiple currencies supported per bid request, then currency should be specified here using ISO-4217 alphabetic codes. Note, this may be different from bid currency returned by bidder, if this is allowed on an exchange.
___bidfloorcur.title: Bid Floor Currency (bidfloorcur)

___tagid.description: Identifier for specific ad placement or ad tag that was used to initiate the auction. This can be useful for debugging of any issues, or for optimization by the buyer.
___tagid.title: Tag id (tagid)

___iframebuster.description: Array of names for supported iframe busters. Exchange specific.
___iframebuster.title: Iframe Buster Names (iframebuster)

___id.description: A unique identifier for this impression within the context of the bid request (typically, value starts with 1, and increments up to n for n impressions)
___id.title: Impression Id (id)

___displaymanager.description: Name of ad mediation partner, SDK technology, or native player responsible for rendering ad (typically video or mobile). Used by some ad servers to customize ad code by partner.
___displaymanager.title: Video/Native display manager (displaymanager)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___expdir.description: Specify properties for an expandable ad. See Table 6.11 Expandable Direction for possible values.
___expdir.title: Expandable properties (expdir)

___w.description: Width of the impression in pixels. Since some ad types are not restricted by size this field is not required, but it’s highly recommended that this information be included when possible.
___w.title: Width (w)

___h.description: Height of the impression in pixels. Since some ad types are not restricted by size this field is not required, but it’s highly recommended that this information be included when possible.
___h.title: Height (h)

___topframe.description: Specify if the banner is delivered in the top frame or in an iframe. '0' means it is not in the top frame, and '1' means that it is.
___topframe.title: Delivery frame (topframe)

___api.description: List of supported API frameworks for this banner. (See Table 6.4 API Frameworks). If an API is not explicitly listed it is assumed not to be supported.
___api.title: Supported API frameworks (api)

___battr.description: Blocked creative attributes. See Table 6.3 Creative Attributes. If blank assume all types are allowed.
___battr.title: Blocked Creative Attributes (battr)

___btype.description: Blocked creative types. See Table 6.2 Banner Ad Types. If blank, assume all types are allowed.
___btype.title: Blocked Creative Types (btype)

___mimes.description: Whitelist of content MIME types supported. Popular MIME types include, but are not limited to 'image/jpg', 'image/gif' and 'application/x-shockwave-flash'
___mimes.title: Mime type whitelist (mimes)

___id.description: Unique identifier for this banner object. Useful for tracking multiple banner objects (e.g., in companion banner array). Usually starts with 1, increasing with each object. Combination of impression id banner object should be unique.
___id.title: Banner Id (id)

___language.description: Language of the content. Use alpha-2/ISO 639-1 codes
___language.title: Content language (language)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___name.description: Content producer or originator name (e.g., 'Warner Bros').
___name.title: Producer Name (name)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___cat.description: Array of IAB content categories for the content producer. See Table 6.1 Content Categories.
___cat.title: Producer Categories (cat)

___id.description: Content producer or originator ID. Useful if content is syndicated, and may be posted on a site using embed tags
___id.title: Producer Id (id)

___embeddable.description: From QAG Video Addendum. If content can be embedded (such as an embeddable video player) this value should be set to '1'. If content cannot be embedded, then this should be set to '0'.
___embeddable.title: Embedability (embeddable)

___livestream.description: Is content live? E.g., live video stream, live blog. '1' means content is live. '0' means it is not live.
___livestream.title: Live (livestream)

___title.description: Content title. Video examples: 'Search Committee' (television) or 'A New Hope' (movie) or 'Endgame' (made for web) Non-video example: 'Why an Antarctic Glacier Is Melting So Quickly' (Time magazine article)
___title.title: Title (title)

___userrating.description: User rating of the content (e.g., number of stars, likes, etc.).
___userrating.title: User Rating (userrating)

___videoquality.description: Video quality per the IAB’s classification. See Table 6.14 Video Quality.
___videoquality.title: Video Quality (videoquality)

___series.description: Content series. Video examples: 'The Office' (television) or 'Star Wars' (movie) or 'Arby ‘N’ The Chief' (made for web) Non-video example: 'Ecocentric' (Time magazine blog)
___series.title: Series (series)

___cat.description: Array of IAB content categories for the content. See Table 6.1 Content Categories.
___cat.title: Categories (cat)

___url.description: Original URL of the content, for buy-side contextualization or review
___url.title: URL (url)

___len.description: Length of content (appropriate for video or audio) in seconds.
___len.title: Length in seconds (len)

___qagmediarating.description: Media rating of the content, per QAG guidelines. See Table 0 QAG Media Ratings for list of possible values
___qagmediarating.title: QAG rating (qagmediarating)

___keywords.description: Comma separated list of keywords describing the content
___keywords.title: Keywords (keywords)

___episode.description: Content episode number (typically applies to video content).
___episode.title: Episode Number (episode)

___season.description: Content season. E.g., 'Season 3' (typically applies to video content).
___season.title: Season (season)

___context.description: Specifies the type of content (game, video, text, etc.). See Table 6.13 Content Context.
___context.title: Type (context)

___id.description: ID uniquely identifying the content
___id.title: Content Id (id)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___id.description: Exchange specific ID for the data provider
___id.title: Provider Id (id)

___name.description: Name of a data provider's segment applicable to the user
___name.title: Segment Name (name)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___value.description: String representing the value of the segment. The method for transmitting this data should be negotiated offline with the data provider. For example for gender, 'male', or 'female', for age, '30-40')
___value.title: Segment Value (value)

___id.description: ID of a data provider's segment applicable to the user
___id.title: Segment Id (id)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___minduration.description: Minimum video ad duration in seconds
___minduration.title: Minimum Duration (minduration)

___h.description: Height of the player in pixels. This field is not required, but it’s highly recommended that this information be included.
___h.title: Player Height (h)

___startdelay.description: Indicates the start delay in seconds for preroll, midroll, or postroll ad placement. See Table 6.9 Video Start Delay for generic placement values
___startdelay.title: Start Delay (startdelay)

___companionad.description: If companion ads are available, they can be listed as an array of banner objects. See Banner Object.
___companionad.title: Companion Ads (companionad)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___expdir.description: Specify properties for an expandable ad. See Table 6.11 Expandable Direction for possible values.
___expdir.title: Expandable properties (expdir)

___w.description: Width of the impression in pixels. Since some ad types are not restricted by size this field is not required, but it’s highly recommended that this information be included when possible.
___w.title: Width (w)

___h.description: Height of the impression in pixels. Since some ad types are not restricted by size this field is not required, but it’s highly recommended that this information be included when possible.
___h.title: Height (h)

___topframe.description: Specify if the banner is delivered in the top frame or in an iframe. '0' means it is not in the top frame, and '1' means that it is.
___topframe.title: Delivery frame (topframe)

___api.description: List of supported API frameworks for this banner. (See Table 6.4 API Frameworks). If an API is not explicitly listed it is assumed not to be supported.
___api.title: Supported API frameworks (api)

___battr.description: Blocked creative attributes. See Table 6.3 Creative Attributes. If blank assume all types are allowed.
___battr.title: Blocked Creative Attributes (battr)

___btype.description: Blocked creative types. See Table 6.2 Banner Ad Types. If blank, assume all types are allowed.
___btype.title: Blocked Creative Types (btype)

___mimes.description: Whitelist of content MIME types supported. Popular MIME types include, but are not limited to 'image/jpg', 'image/gif' and 'application/x-shockwave-flash'
___mimes.title: Mime type whitelist (mimes)

___id.description: Unique identifier for this banner object. Useful for tracking multiple banner objects (e.g., in companion banner array). Usually starts with 1, increasing with each object. Combination of impression id banner object should be unique.
___id.title: Banner Id (id)

___maxextended.description: Maximum extended video ad duration, if extension is allowed.  If blank or 0, extension is not allowed. If -1, extension is allowed, and there is no time limit imposed. If greater than 0, then the value represents the number of seconds of extended play supported beyond the maxduration value.
___maxextended.title: Maximum extended duration (maxextended)

___delivery.description: List of supported delivery methods (streaming, progressive). If blank, assume all are supported. See Table 6.12 Content Delivery Methods for a list of possible values.
___delivery.title: Delivery methods (delivery)

___mimes.description: Content MIME types supported. Popular MIME types include, but are not limited to 'video/x-mswmv' for Windows Media, and 'video/x-flv' for Flash Video.
___mimes.title: Mime type whitelist (mimes)

___linearity.description: Indicates whether the ad impression is linear or non-linear. See Table 6.6 Video Linearity for a list of the possible values
___linearity.title: Video Linearity (linearity)

___minbitrate.description: Minimum bit rate in Kbps. Exchange may set this dynamically, or universally across their set of publishers.
___minbitrate.title: Minimum bitrate (minbitrate)

___w.description: Width of the player in pixels. This field is not required, but it’s highly recommended that this information be included.
___w.title: Player Width (w)

___sequence.description: If multiple ad impressions are offered in the same bid request, the sequence number will allow for the coordinated delivery of multiple creatives
___sequence.title: Ad Sequency (sequence)

___playbackmethod.description: List of allowed playback methods. If blank, assume that all are allowed. See Table 6.8 Video Playback Methods for a list of possible values.
___playbackmethod.title: Playback methods (playbackmethod)

___api.description: List of supported API frameworks for this impression. (See Table 6.4 API Frameworks). If an API is not explicitly listed it is assumed not to be supported.
___api.title: Supported APIs (api)

___protocol.description: Video bid response protocols.  See Table 6.7 Video Bid Response Protocols for a list of possible values
___protocol.title: Protocol (protocol)

___maxbitrate.description: Maximum bit rate in Kbps. Exchange may set this dynamically, or universally across their set of publishers.
___maxbitrate.title: Maximum bitrate (maxbitrate)

___battr.description: Blocked creative attributes. See Table 6.3 Creative Attributes. If blank assume all types are allowed.
___battr.title: Blocked creative attributes (battr)

___companiontype.description: Recommended if companion objects are included. See Table 6.17 VAST Companion Types for a list of possible values.
___companiontype.title: Companion Types (companiontype)

___maxduration.description: Maximum video ad duration in seconds
___maxduration.title: Maximum Duration (maxduration)

___boxingallowed.description: If exchange publisher has rules preventing letter boxing of 4x3 content to play in a 16x9 window, then this should be set to false. Default setting is true, which assumes that boxing of content to fit into a window is allowed. '1' indicates boxing is allowed. '0' indicates it is not allowed.
___boxingallowed.title: Boxing (boxingallowed)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___dpidmd5.description: MD5 hashed platform-specific ID (e.g., Android ID or UDID for iOS). Should be interpreted as case insensitive.
___dpidmd5.title: Platform Id MD5 hash (dpidmd5)

___devicetype.description: Return the device type being used. See Table 6.16 Device Type.
___devicetype.title: Device type (devicetype)

___dnt.description: If '0', then do not track Is set to false, if '1', then do no track is set to true in browser.
___dnt.title: Do Not Track (dnt)

___connectiontype.description: Return the detected data connection type for the device. See Table 6.10 Connection Type.
___connectiontype.title: Connection type (connectiontype)

___didsha1.description: SHA1 hashed device ID; IMEI when available, else MEID or ESN. OpenRTB's preferred method for device ID hashing is SHA1.
___didsha1.title: Device ID SHA1 hash (didsha1)

___js.description: '1' if the device supports JavaScript; else '0'
___js.title: JavaScript Support (js)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___metro.description: Pass the metro code (see http://code.google.com/apis/adwords/docs/appendix/metrocodes.html). Metro codes are similar to but not exactly the same as Nielsen DMAs.
___metro.title: Metro Code (metro)

___lat.description: Latitude from -90 to 90. South is negative. This should only be passed if known to be accurate (For example, not the centroid of a postal code).
___lat.title: Latitude (lat)

___type.description: Indicate the source of the geo data (GPS, IP address, user provided). See Table 6.15 Location Type for a list of potential values.  Type should be provided when lat/lon is provided.
___type.title: Location Data Source (type)

___city.description: City using United Nations Code for Trade and Transport Locations (http://www.unece.org/cefact/locode/service/location.htm)
___city.title: City (city)

___regionfips104.description: Region of a country using fips 10-4 notation (alternative to ISO 3166-2)
___regionfips104.title: Region in fips 10-4 notation (regionfips104)

___lon.description: Longitude from -180 to 180. West is negative. This should only be passed if known to be accurate.
___lon.title: Longitude (lon)

___geo.description: Geography as derived from the device's location services (e.g., cell tower triangulation, GPS) or IP address. See Error! Reference source ot found..
___geo.title: Location data (geo)

___carrier.description: Carrier or ISP derived from the IP address.  Should be specified using Mobile Network Code (MNC) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mobile_Network_Code
___carrier.title: Device Carrier (carrier)

___dpidsha1.description: SHA1 hashed platform-specific ID (e.g., Android ID or UDID for iOS). OpenRTB's preferred method for device ID hash is SHA1.
___dpidsha1.title: Platform Id SHA1 hash (dpidsha1)

___didmd5.description: MD5 hashed device ID; IMEI when available, else MEID or ESN. Should be interpreted as case insensitive.
___didmd5.title: Device ID MD5 hash (didmd5)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___metro.description: Pass the metro code (see http://code.google.com/apis/adwords/docs/appendix/metrocodes.html). Metro codes are similar to but not exactly the same as Nielsen DMAs.
___metro.title: Metro Code (metro)

___lat.description: Latitude from -90 to 90. South is negative. This should only be passed if known to be accurate (For example, not the centroid of a postal code).
___lat.title: Latitude (lat)

___type.description: Indicate the source of the geo data (GPS, IP address, user provided). See Table 6.15 Location Type for a list of potential values.  Type should be provided when lat/lon is provided.
___type.title: Location Data Source (type)

___city.description: City using United Nations Code for Trade and Transport Locations (http://www.unece.org/cefact/locode/service/location.htm)
___city.title: City (city)

___regionfips104.description: Region of a country using fips 10-4 notation (alternative to ISO 3166-2)
___regionfips104.title: Region in fips 10-4 notation (regionfips104)

___lon.description: Longitude from -180 to 180. West is negative. This should only be passed if known to be accurate.
___lon.title: Longitude (lon)

___customdata.description: If supported by the exchange, this is custom data that the bidder had stored in the exchange's cookie. The string may be in base85 cookie safe characters, and be in any format. This may useful for storing user features. Note: Proper JSON encoding must be used to include 'escaped' quotation marks.
___customdata.title: Custom Data (customdata)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___metro.description: Pass the metro code (see http://code.google.com/apis/adwords/docs/appendix/metrocodes.html). Metro codes are similar to but not exactly the same as Nielsen DMAs.
___metro.title: Metro Code (metro)

___lat.description: Latitude from -90 to 90. South is negative. This should only be passed if known to be accurate (For example, not the centroid of a postal code).
___lat.title: Latitude (lat)

___type.description: Indicate the source of the geo data (GPS, IP address, user provided). See Table 6.15 Location Type for a list of potential values.  Type should be provided when lat/lon is provided.
___type.title: Location Data Source (type)

___city.description: City using United Nations Code for Trade and Transport Locations (http://www.unece.org/cefact/locode/service/location.htm)
___city.title: City (city)

___regionfips104.description: Region of a country using fips 10-4 notation (alternative to ISO 3166-2)
___regionfips104.title: Region in fips 10-4 notation (regionfips104)

___lon.description: Longitude from -180 to 180. West is negative. This should only be passed if known to be accurate.
___lon.title: Longitude (lon)

___geo.description: Home geo for the user (e.g., based off of registration data); this is different from the current location of the access device (that is defined by the geo object embedded in the Device Object)
___geo.title: Home Location (geo)

___yob.description: Year of birth as a 4-digit integer.
___yob.title: Year Of Birth (yob)

___keywords.description: Comma separated list of keywords of consumer interests or intent.
___keywords.title: Keywords (keywords)

___gender.description: Gender as 'M' male, 'F' female, 'O' Other. (Null indicates unknown)
___gender.title: Gender (gender)

___buyeruid.description: Buyer's user ID for this user as mapped by exchange for the buyer.
___buyeruid.title: Buyer User Id (buyeruid)

___id.description: Unique consumer ID of this user on the exchange.
___id.title: User Id (id)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___id.description: Exchange specific ID for the data provider
___id.title: Provider Id (id)

___name.description: Content producer or originator name (e.g., 'Warner Bros').
___name.title: Producer Name (name)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___cat.description: Array of IAB content categories for the content producer. See Table 6.1 Content Categories.
___cat.title: Producer Categories (cat)

___id.description: Content producer or originator ID. Useful if content is syndicated, and may be posted on a site using embed tags
___id.title: Producer Id (id)

___name.description: Name of a data provider's segment applicable to the user
___name.title: Segment Name (name)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___value.description: String representing the value of the segment. The method for transmitting this data should be negotiated offline with the data provider. For example for gender, 'male', or 'female', for age, '30-40')
___value.title: Segment Value (value)

___id.description: ID of a data provider's segment applicable to the user
___id.title: Segment Id (id)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___privacypolicy.description: Specifies whether the site has a privacy policy. '1' means there is a policy. '0' means there is not.
___privacypolicy.title: Privacy Policy (privacypolicy)

___name.description: Publisher name (may be masked at publisher’s request).
___name.title: Publisher Name (name)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___cat.description: Array of IAB content categories for the publisher. See Table 6.1 Content Categories.
___cat.title: Publisher Categories (cat)

___domain.description: Publisher’s highest level domain name, for example 'foopub.com'.
___domain.title: Publisher Domain (domain)

___id.description: Publisher ID on the exchange
___id.title: Publisher Id (id)

___ref.description: Referrer URL that caused navigation to the current page.
___ref.title: Referal URL (ref)

___name.description: Site name (may be masked at publisher’s request).
___name.title: Site Name (name)

___cat.description: Array of IAB content categories for the overall site. See Table 6.1 Content Categories.
___cat.title: Site Categories (cat)

___page.description: URL of the page where the impression will be shown.
___page.title: Page URL (page)

___language.description: Language of the content. Use alpha-2/ISO 639-1 codes
___language.title: Content language (language)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___embeddable.description: From QAG Video Addendum. If content can be embedded (such as an embeddable video player) this value should be set to '1'. If content cannot be embedded, then this should be set to '0'.
___embeddable.title: Embedability (embeddable)

___livestream.description: Is content live? E.g., live video stream, live blog. '1' means content is live. '0' means it is not live.
___livestream.title: Live (livestream)

___title.description: Content title. Video examples: 'Search Committee' (television) or 'A New Hope' (movie) or 'Endgame' (made for web) Non-video example: 'Why an Antarctic Glacier Is Melting So Quickly' (Time magazine article)
___title.title: Title (title)

___userrating.description: User rating of the content (e.g., number of stars, likes, etc.).
___userrating.title: User Rating (userrating)

___videoquality.description: Video quality per the IAB’s classification. See Table 6.14 Video Quality.
___videoquality.title: Video Quality (videoquality)

___series.description: Content series. Video examples: 'The Office' (television) or 'Star Wars' (movie) or 'Arby ‘N’ The Chief' (made for web) Non-video example: 'Ecocentric' (Time magazine blog)
___series.title: Series (series)

___cat.description: Array of IAB content categories for the content. See Table 6.1 Content Categories.
___cat.title: Categories (cat)

___url.description: Original URL of the content, for buy-side contextualization or review
___url.title: URL (url)

___len.description: Length of content (appropriate for video or audio) in seconds.
___len.title: Length in seconds (len)

___qagmediarating.description: Media rating of the content, per QAG guidelines. See Table 0 QAG Media Ratings for list of possible values
___qagmediarating.title: QAG rating (qagmediarating)

___keywords.description: Comma separated list of keywords describing the content
___keywords.title: Keywords (keywords)

___episode.description: Content episode number (typically applies to video content).
___episode.title: Episode Number (episode)

___season.description: Content season. E.g., 'Season 3' (typically applies to video content).
___season.title: Season (season)

___context.description: Specifies the type of content (game, video, text, etc.). See Table 6.13 Content Context.
___context.title: Type (context)

___id.description: ID uniquely identifying the content
___id.title: Content Id (id)

___pagecat.description: Array of IAB content categories for the current page. See Table 6.1 Content Categories.
___pagecat.title: Page Categories (pagecat)

___search.description: Search string that caused navigation to the current page.
___search.title: Search String (search)

___keywords.description: List of keywords describing this site in a comma separated string.
___keywords.title: Keywords (keywords)

___sectioncat.description: Array of IAB content categories for the current subsection of the site. See Table 6.1 Content Categories.
___sectioncat.title: Site Section Categories (sectioncat)

___domain.description: Domain of the site, used for advertiser side blocking. For example, 'foo.com'.
___domain.title: Site Domain (domain)

___id.description: Site ID on the exchange
___id.title: Site Id (id)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___bundle.description: Application bundle or package name (e.g., com.foo.mygame). This is intended to be a unique ID across multiple exchanges.
___bundle.title: App Bundle (bundle)

___privacypolicy.description: Specifies whether the app has a privacy policy. '1' means there is a policy and '0' means there is not
___privacypolicy.title: App Privacy Policy (privacypolicy)

___name.description: Publisher name (may be masked at publisher’s request).
___name.title: Publisher Name (name)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___cat.description: Array of IAB content categories for the publisher. See Table 6.1 Content Categories.
___cat.title: Publisher Categories (cat)

___domain.description: Publisher’s highest level domain name, for example 'foopub.com'.
___domain.title: Publisher Domain (domain)

___id.description: Publisher ID on the exchange
___id.title: Publisher Id (id)

___name.description: Application name (may be masked at publisher’s request).
___name.title: App Name (name)

___paid.description: '1' if the application is a paid version; else '0' (i.e., free).
___paid.title: App Type (paid)

___storeurl.description: For QAG 1.5 compliance, an app store URL for an installed app should be passed in the bid request.
___storeurl.title: App Store URL (storeurl)

___cat.description: Array of IAB content categories for the overall application. See Table 6.1 Content Categories.
___cat.title: App Categories (cat)

___language.description: Language of the content. Use alpha-2/ISO 639-1 codes
___language.title: Content language (language)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___embeddable.description: From QAG Video Addendum. If content can be embedded (such as an embeddable video player) this value should be set to '1'. If content cannot be embedded, then this should be set to '0'.
___embeddable.title: Embedability (embeddable)

___livestream.description: Is content live? E.g., live video stream, live blog. '1' means content is live. '0' means it is not live.
___livestream.title: Live (livestream)

___title.description: Content title. Video examples: 'Search Committee' (television) or 'A New Hope' (movie) or 'Endgame' (made for web) Non-video example: 'Why an Antarctic Glacier Is Melting So Quickly' (Time magazine article)
___title.title: Title (title)

___userrating.description: User rating of the content (e.g., number of stars, likes, etc.).
___userrating.title: User Rating (userrating)

___videoquality.description: Video quality per the IAB’s classification. See Table 6.14 Video Quality.
___videoquality.title: Video Quality (videoquality)

___series.description: Content series. Video examples: 'The Office' (television) or 'Star Wars' (movie) or 'Arby ‘N’ The Chief' (made for web) Non-video example: 'Ecocentric' (Time magazine blog)
___series.title: Series (series)

___cat.description: Array of IAB content categories for the content. See Table 6.1 Content Categories.
___cat.title: Categories (cat)

___url.description: Original URL of the content, for buy-side contextualization or review
___url.title: URL (url)

___len.description: Length of content (appropriate for video or audio) in seconds.
___len.title: Length in seconds (len)

___qagmediarating.description: Media rating of the content, per QAG guidelines. See Table 0 QAG Media Ratings for list of possible values
___qagmediarating.title: QAG rating (qagmediarating)

___keywords.description: Comma separated list of keywords describing the content
___keywords.title: Keywords (keywords)

___episode.description: Content episode number (typically applies to video content).
___episode.title: Episode Number (episode)

___season.description: Content season. E.g., 'Season 3' (typically applies to video content).
___season.title: Season (season)

___context.description: Specifies the type of content (game, video, text, etc.). See Table 6.13 Content Context.
___context.title: Type (context)

___id.description: ID uniquely identifying the content
___id.title: Content Id (id)

___pagecat.description: Array of IAB content categories for the current page/view of the app. See Table 6.1 Content Categories.
___pagecat.title: App Page/View Categories (pagecat)

___keywords.description: List of keywords describing this app in a comma separated string
___keywords.title: Keywords (keywords)

___sectioncat.description: Array of IAB content categories for the current subsection of the app. See Table 6.1 Content Categories.
___sectioncat.title: App Section Categories (sectioncat)

___id.description: Application ID on the exchange.
___id.title: App Id (id)

___name.description: Publisher name (may be masked at publisher’s request).
___name.title: Publisher Name (name)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___cat.description: Array of IAB content categories for the publisher. See Table 6.1 Content Categories.
___cat.title: Publisher Categories (cat)

___domain.description: Publisher’s highest level domain name, for example 'foopub.com'.
___domain.title: Publisher Domain (domain)

___id.description: Publisher ID on the exchange
___id.title: Publisher Id (id)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___bundle.description: Application bundle or package name (e.g., com.foo.mygame). This is intended to be a unique ID across multiple exchanges.
___bundle.title: App Bundle (bundle)

___privacypolicy.description: Specifies whether the app has a privacy policy. '1' means there is a policy and '0' means there is not
___privacypolicy.title: App Privacy Policy (privacypolicy)

___name.description: Application name (may be masked at publisher’s request).
___name.title: App Name (name)

___paid.description: '1' if the application is a paid version; else '0' (i.e., free).
___paid.title: App Type (paid)

___storeurl.description: For QAG 1.5 compliance, an app store URL for an installed app should be passed in the bid request.
___storeurl.title: App Store URL (storeurl)

___cat.description: Array of IAB content categories for the overall application. See Table 6.1 Content Categories.
___cat.title: App Categories (cat)

___pagecat.description: Array of IAB content categories for the current page/view of the app. See Table 6.1 Content Categories.
___pagecat.title: App Page/View Categories (pagecat)

___keywords.description: List of keywords describing this app in a comma separated string
___keywords.title: Keywords (keywords)

___sectioncat.description: Array of IAB content categories for the current subsection of the app. See Table 6.1 Content Categories.
___sectioncat.title: App Section Categories (sectioncat)

___id.description: Application ID on the exchange.
___id.title: App Id (id)

___app.description: Publisher application definition.  A bid request must not contain both a site object and an app object.
___app.title: Publishing Application (app)

___cur.description: Array of allowed currencies for bids on this bid request using ISO-4217 alphabetic codes. If only one currency is used by the exchange, this parameter is not required.
___cur.title: Currencies (cur)

___wseat.description: Array of buyer seats allowed to bid on this auction. Seats are an optional feature of exchange. For example, ['4','34','82','A45'] indicates that only advertisers using these exchange seats are allowed to bid on the impressions in this auction
___wseat.title: Buyer Seats (wseat)

___badv.description: Array of strings of blocked toplevel domains of advertisers. For example, {'company1.com', 'company2.com'}
___badv.title: Blocked Advertiser Domains (badv)

___bcat.description: Blocked Advertiser Categories. Note that there is no existing categorization / taxonomy of advertiser industries. However, as a substitute exchanges may decide to use IAB categories as an approximation (See Table 6.1 Content Categories)
___bcat.title: Blocked Advertiser Categories (bcat)

___allimps.description: Flag to indicate whether Exchange can verify that all impressions offered represent all of the impressions available in context (e.g., all impressions available on the web page; all impressions available for a video [pre, mid and postroll spots], etc.) to support road-blocking. A true value should only be passed if the exchange is aware of all impressions in context for the publisher. '0' means the exchange cannot verify, and '1' means that all impressions represent all impressions available.
___allimps.title: All Impression Availability (allimps)

___imp.description: Array of impression objects. Multiple impression auctions may be specified in a single bid request. At least one impression is required for a valid bid request.
___imp.title: Impressions (impressions)

___video.description: A reference to a video object. Either a banner or video object (or both if the impression could be either) must be included in an impression object.
___video.title: A video object (video)

___instl.description: 1 if the ad is interstitial or full screen; else 0 (i.e., no).
___instl.title: Interstitial/Full Screen (instl)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___banner.description: A reference to a banner object. Either a banner or video object(or both if the impression could be either) must be included in an impression object
___banner.title: A banner object (banner)

___displaymanagerver.description: Version of ad mediation partner, SDK technology, or native player responsible for rendering ad (typically video or mobile). Used by some ad servers to customize ad code by partner
___displaymanagerver.title: Video/Native display manager version (displaymanagerver)

___bidfloor.description: Bid floor for this impression (in CPM of bidfloorcur).
___bidfloor.title: Bid Floor (bidfloor)

___bidfloorcur.description: If bid floor is specified and multiple currencies supported per bid request, then currency should be specified here using ISO-4217 alphabetic codes. Note, this may be different from bid currency returned by bidder, if this is allowed on an exchange.
___bidfloorcur.title: Bid Floor Currency (bidfloorcur)

___tagid.description: Identifier for specific ad placement or ad tag that was used to initiate the auction. This can be useful for debugging of any issues, or for optimization by the buyer.
___tagid.title: Tag id (tagid)

___iframebuster.description: Array of names for supported iframe busters. Exchange specific.
___iframebuster.title: Iframe Buster Names (iframebuster)

___id.description: A unique identifier for this impression within the context of the bid request (typically, value starts with 1, and increments up to n for n impressions)
___id.title: Impression Id (id)

___displaymanager.description: Name of ad mediation partner, SDK technology, or native player responsible for rendering ad (typically video or mobile). Used by some ad servers to customize ad code by partner.
___displaymanager.title: Video/Native display manager (displaymanager)

___tmax.description: Maximum amount of time in milliseconds to submit a bid (e.g., 120 means the bidder has 120ms to submit a bid before the auction is complete). If this value never changes across an exchange, then the exchange can supply this information offline.
___tmax.title: Maximum Bid Time (tmax)

___customdata.description: If supported by the exchange, this is custom data that the bidder had stored in the exchange's cookie. The string may be in base85 cookie safe characters, and be in any format. This may useful for storing user features. Note: Proper JSON encoding must be used to include 'escaped' quotation marks.
___customdata.title: Custom Data (customdata)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___geo.description: Home geo for the user (e.g., based off of registration data); this is different from the current location of the access device (that is defined by the geo object embedded in the Device Object)
___geo.title: Home Location (geo)

___yob.description: Year of birth as a 4-digit integer.
___yob.title: Year Of Birth (yob)

___keywords.description: Comma separated list of keywords of consumer interests or intent.
___keywords.title: Keywords (keywords)

___gender.description: Gender as 'M' male, 'F' female, 'O' Other. (Null indicates unknown)
___gender.title: Gender (gender)

___buyeruid.description: Buyer's user ID for this user as mapped by exchange for the buyer.
___buyeruid.title: Buyer User Id (buyeruid)

___id.description: Unique consumer ID of this user on the exchange.
___id.title: User Id (id)

___at.description: If “1”, then first price auction. If “2”, then second price auction. Additional auction types can be defined as per the exchange’s business rules.  Exchange specific rules should be numbered over 500
___at.title: Auction type (at)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___privacypolicy.description: Specifies whether the site has a privacy policy. '1' means there is a policy. '0' means there is not.
___privacypolicy.title: Privacy Policy (privacypolicy)

___ref.description: Referrer URL that caused navigation to the current page.
___ref.title: Referal URL (ref)

___name.description: Site name (may be masked at publisher’s request).
___name.title: Site Name (name)

___cat.description: Array of IAB content categories for the overall site. See Table 6.1 Content Categories.
___cat.title: Site Categories (cat)

___page.description: URL of the page where the impression will be shown.
___page.title: Page URL (page)

___pagecat.description: Array of IAB content categories for the current page. See Table 6.1 Content Categories.
___pagecat.title: Page Categories (pagecat)

___search.description: Search string that caused navigation to the current page.
___search.title: Search String (search)

___keywords.description: List of keywords describing this site in a comma separated string.
___keywords.title: Keywords (keywords)

___sectioncat.description: Array of IAB content categories for the current subsection of the site. See Table 6.1 Content Categories.
___sectioncat.title: Site Section Categories (sectioncat)

___domain.description: Domain of the site, used for advertiser side blocking. For example, 'foo.com'.
___domain.title: Site Domain (domain)

___id.description: Site ID on the exchange
___id.title: Site Id (id)

___site.description: Publisher site definition.  A bid request must not contain both a site object and an app object.
___site.title: Publisher Site (site)

___ext.description: This object is a placeholder that may contain custom JSON agreed to by the parties in an OpenRTB transaction to support flexibility beyond the standard defined in this specification.
___ext.title: Custom JSON (ext)

___dpidmd5.description: MD5 hashed platform-specific ID (e.g., Android ID or UDID for iOS). Should be interpreted as case insensitive.
___dpidmd5.title: Platform Id MD5 hash (dpidmd5)

___devicetype.description: Return the device type being used. See Table 6.16 Device Type.
___devicetype.title: Device type (devicetype)

___dnt.description: If '0', then do not track Is set to false, if '1', then do no track is set to true in browser.
___dnt.title: Do Not Track (dnt)

___connectiontype.description: Return the detected data connection type for the device. See Table 6.10 Connection Type.
___connectiontype.title: Connection type (connectiontype)

___didsha1.description: SHA1 hashed device ID; IMEI when available, else MEID or ESN. OpenRTB's preferred method for device ID hashing is SHA1.
___didsha1.title: Device ID SHA1 hash (didsha1)

___js.description: '1' if the device supports JavaScript; else '0'
___js.title: JavaScript Support (js)

___geo.description: Geography as derived from the device's location services (e.g., cell tower triangulation, GPS) or IP address. See Error! Reference source ot found..
___geo.title: Location data (geo)

___carrier.description: Carrier or ISP derived from the IP address.  Should be specified using Mobile Network Code (MNC) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mobile_Network_Code
___carrier.title: Device Carrier (carrier)

___dpidsha1.description: SHA1 hashed platform-specific ID (e.g., Android ID or UDID for iOS). OpenRTB's preferred method for device ID hash is SHA1.
___dpidsha1.title: Platform Id SHA1 hash (dpidsha1)

___didmd5.description: MD5 hashed device ID; IMEI when available, else MEID or ESN. Should be interpreted as case insensitive.
___didmd5.title: Device ID MD5 hash (didmd5)

___id.description: Unique ID of the bid request, provided by the exchange.
___id.title: Id (id)
